Answer ALL questions. Write your answers in the spaces provided.

A particle P of mass 0.5 kg is moving along the positive x-axis under the action of a single
force, directed towards the origin O. When OP =x metres, the force has magnitude

k ; ;
sz newtons, where k is a constant, and the speed of P is vms"!.
x

When P is 2m from O, the speed of P is 5ms"! and P is moving in the positive x direction.

When P is 5m from O, the speed of P is 4ms"! and P is moving in the positive x direction.

Find v2 in terms of x.

(3)

P 5 5 8 7 4 A 0 2 2 8

attached to a particle of mass m. The other end of the spring 1s attached to a fixed point A
on a rough horizontal plane. The particle 1s held at a point B on the plane, where
AB = 1.251, and released from rest. The particle first comes to instantaneous rest at the
point C on the plane, where AC = 0.97.

Find the coefficient of friction between the particle and the plane.

Figure 1

A cone is removed from a uniform solid right circular cylinder of mass / to form the solid
with a conical hole shown shaded in Figure 1. A container is made by fixing a uniform

l
conical shell of mass pM in the hole. The cylinder has radius 27 and height 2h, the

conical hole has base radius r and height 4 and the conical shell has base radius 6r and
height 6h. The vertex of the shell coincides with the vertex of the hole. The axis of the
Shell, the axis of the hole and the axis of the cylinder are all vertical and coincide. The
centre of the plane circular base of the container is O, as shown in Figure 1.

Find, in terms of /, the distance of the centre of mass of the container from O.

(6)

Figure 2

One end of a light inextensible string of length 5a is attached to a point A on the
circumference of a circular disc of radius 5a and centre O. The other end of the string is
attached to a particle P of mass m. A second light inextensible string has length 8a. This
string has one end attached to the point B vertically below O, where OB = 4a, and the
other end attached to P, as shown in Figure 2. The disc rotates in a horizontal plane with
constant angular speed. The particle P moves in a horizontal circle centre B with the same
constant angular speed as the disc. Both strings are taut and are 1n a vertical plane through
O throughout the motion.

Given that string PB will break if the tension in it exceeds 4 me, find the greatest possible

angular speed of P.
(10)

6. A particle P moves in a vertical circle, with centre O and radius 7, on the smooth inner
surface of a fixed hollow spherical shell. The point A lies on the inner surface of the shell
and the line OA 1s at 30° below the horizontal. Initially P is projected downwards from A
with speed uw in a direction perpendicular to OA. The particle first loses contact with the

20

shell at the point B where the line OB 1s at 30° above the horizontal.

(a) Show that the speed of P at B is >

(b) Hence find uw in terms of r and g.

After P has lost contact with the shell, P moves freely under gravity.
The lowest point of the inner surface of the shell is C.

(c) Find the greatest height reached by P above the level of C.

A particle P of mass m is attached to one end of a light elastic string, of natural length /
and modulus of elasticity A. The other end of the string is attached to a fixed point A ona

smooth plane which is inclined to the horizontal at angle a, where sina = : . The particle

rests in equilibrium on the plane at the point B with the string lying along a line of greatest
slope of the plane, as shown in Figure 4.

Given that AB = - l

(3)

with centre B.
